root: ^The main type of ancient megalithic edifice found in Sardinia, developed during the Nuragic Age between 1900 and 730 BC.
^Today it is the symbol of Sardinia and its distinctive culture, the Nuragic civilization.

^There is no consensus on the function of the nuraghes: they could have been religious temples, ordinary dwellings, rulers' residences, military strongholds, meeting halls, or a combination of the former.
^Some of the nuraghes are, however, located in strategic places such as hills from which important passages could be easily controlled.
^Nuraghes are inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage Site list.
